title: On $q$-deformed cubic equations: the quantum heptagon and nonagon
abstract:
The recent notion of $q$-deformed irrational numbers is characterized by the
invariance with respect to the action of the modular group $\PSL(2,\Z)$, or
equivalently under the Burau representation of the braid group~$B_3$. The
theory of $q$-deformed quadratic irrationals and quadratic equations with
integer coefficients is known and entirely based on this invariance. In this
paper, we consider the case of cubic irrationals. We show that irreducible
cubic equations with three distinct real roots and cyclic Galois group~$C_3$
(or $\Z/3\Z$) acting by a third order element of $\PSL(2,\Z)$, have a canonical
$q$-deformation, that we describe. This class of cubic equations contains
well-known examples including the equations that describe regular $7$- and
$9$-gons.
